overview_of_class: Religion is a global phenomenon, affecting people, societies, and cultures across the world, but what is " eligion", and how do we study it? In this course, students will consider basic questions about religions from a variety of perspectives employed in the contemporary study of religion. Materials for this course will examine multiple traditions, geographical locations, and historical periods. This course will critically examine religious texts, beliefs, histories, theologies, practices, rituals, spaces, and places within larger social, political, cultural, and media contexts. One goal of the course is to critically explore and understand various ways of being "religious". Students will leave this course better informed and able to discuss the variety of religious experiences and expressions.
